abstract: The pressure infiltration of densely packed alumina particle preforms with molten aluminium produces defect-free composites containing roughly equal proportions of metal and ceramic. The process affords considerable latitude in microstructural design of the resulting composites. In particular, the matrix can be kept microstructurally simple, and the size of the reinforcement can be varied roughly between 3 and 100 μm.
title: Deformation of Highly Loaded Alumina Reinforced Aluminium Composites: Internal Damage and the Size Effect
